alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 3:22PM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Baton Rouge and Livingston. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM CST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 5.5 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denham Springs, Walker and Shenandoah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
